democratic principles and notions in newspapers and public debates

comment.narrative: Lack of awareness and censuses on the ongoing national political reform.

• Implement phase 2 of the BIPD website revamp • Develop new video content to be used on the website and BIPD training/awareness events • Establish e-Library to be used for BIPD users and end customers • Implement a document management system for all BIPD archives to be accessible by users and end customers of BIPD

- Website phase 1 completed June 2016 - Requirement gathering for phase 2 completed - RFP issued, currently evaluating vendors.
• Develop new video content to be used on the website and BIPD training/awareness events

description.narrative: Enhanced inter-ministrial coordination for Trade and Development and better consolidation of trade efforts

comment.narrative: Limited inter-minisetrial coordination in governmental efforts in the areas of Trade and Development

- Technical advice provided on Bahrain’s obligations under different WTO agreements - Recommendations made to enhance the utilization of Bahrain-US FTA - Economic and trade operational plan proposed - Technical advice on Bahrain’s commitments under the TFA provided - Awareness and capacity of key stakeholders enhanced on TFA requirements and issues

- Technical advice was provided on Bahrain’s obligations under different WTO agreements and the outcome of the Nairobi - WTO Ministerial held in December 2015 as well as on a number of related issues - Clear recommendations were made to enhance the utilization of Bahrain-US FTA - In collaboration with UNCTAD expert, economic and trade operational plan was proposed - Technical advice on Bahrain’s commitments under the TFA was provided - Awareness and capacity of key stakeholders was enhanced on TFA requirements and issues
1) Technical advice provided on Bahrain’s obligations under different WTO agreements 2) Technical advice on Bahrain’s commitments under the TFA provided 3) Conduct project closing

The project was extended for 2 months and advisory and consultation services were conducted to support preparing papers on Bahrain's contribution to global economy along with enhancing the percentage of export. The project also supported the ministry in preparing for the WTO ministerial meeting.

description.narrative: Ministry of Social Development - Support to the Development of the National Childhood Strategy and the National Strategy for Persons with Disabilities for the Kingdom of Bahrain

title.narrative: National Childhood Strategy - Project Document- Extension
Terminal Evaluation of the National Strategies on Childhood, and Persons with Disabilities

description.narrative: National Childhood Strategy (NCS) with emphasis on the four major rights (education, health, protection and participation) for Bahrain is developed and finalized along with an updated multi-sectoral work plan.
independent political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration
National Childhood Strategy is produced and approved by all line Ministries.

comment.narrative: National Childhood Strategy (NCS) for Bahrain is not available

- Finalize the database of all stakeholders related to the areas of childhood, disability and elderly, and produce a report that maps who is doing what on the national level. -Start drafting the National disability periodic report, which should be finalized by end of March 2017. - Submit review of best international practices in the establishment and functioning of “research and analysis units” in the areas of child, disability, elderly and other social issues. - present a thorough paper to the office of the Minister, showcasing three good examples of the practice framework for the delivery of child, disability and elderly services in countries which have set high standards in social service delivery - initiate the process of drafting the Childhood Periodic Report

- A database of all stakeholders related to the areas of childhood, disability and elderly, and produce a report that maps who is doing what on the national level has been developed. - About 80% of the first draft of the National disability periodic report, which should be finalized by end of March 2017 is completed and shared with MoLSD. - Review of best international practices in the establishment and functioning of “research and analysis units” in the areas of child, disability, elderly and other social issues has been shared with MoLSD - A thorough paper presenting three good examples of the practice framework for the delivery of child, disability and elderly services in countries to set high standards in social service delivery has been submitted to the Minister's office. . - The process of drafting the Childhood Periodic Report has been initiated, a consultant has been hired to do draft it..

1. Develop the an accumulative and updated version of the National Childhood Report (4th-6th) be submitted to the (Childhood Rights Committee in Geneva). 2. Develop the an accumulative Report on Persons with Disability (1st and 2nd) to be submitted to the (Committee on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in Geneva).

1. An accumulative and updated version of the National Childhood Report (4th-6th) is completed and ready to be submitted to the (Childhood Rights Committee in Geneva) by the Government of Bahrain. 2. An accumulative Report on Persons with Disability (1st and 2nd) is completed and ready to be submitted to the (Committee on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in Geneva) by the Government of Bahrain.

title.narrative: Capacity Development Facility Established at BIPA

description.narrative: Bahrain Institute for Public Administration (BIPA) - Establishing a Capacity Development Facility at BIPA in the Kingdom of Bahrain
Establishing Capacity Development Facility at Bahrain Institute for Public Administration in the Kindgom of Bahrain
capital of a political entity
policy, planning and administration
Specialized Capacity Development Unit (CDF) with clear manadate is in existence at BIPA.

comment.narrative: No specialized unit for Capacity Assessment/ Development and staff in the field at BIPA.

- Conduct the Second MENAPAR Conference in Muscat, Oman. - Showcase best practices from different Arab countries prior to the second MENAPAR Conference. - Present the results of the six public administration studies conducted in 6 Arab countries in the MENAPAR Conference. - Develop new PD for a new pipeline project to institutionalize the MENAPAR.

- The Second MENAPAR Conference was conducted in Muscat, Oman. - Best practices from different Arab countries were showcased prior to the second MENAPAR Conference. - The results of the six public administration studies were presented in the MENAPAR Conference. - New PD for a new pipeline project to institutionalize the MENAPAR was prepared and submitted to Gov.
- Develp a new Project Document focusing on enhancing the MENAPAR public administration network, followed by a closing final evaluation report.

- A separate PD has been developed as a new project focusing on the enhancing of the MENAPAR public administration network, entitled (Institutionalizing MENAPAR). The new project has been signed on 11 September 2017. - Developing of a final closing report of the CDF has been initiated (Consultant identified and hired) and the report is to be completed and submitted to counterpart by 15 January

description.narrative: Establishment of Centre for Sustainable Energy in Bahrain in partnership with the Ministry of Energy. The Unit will be responsible for establishing strategies and policies and legislations.

title.narrative: Project Document - 00089268 Bahrain Unit for Sustainable Energy
Design, supply, installation and commissioning of 8 kWp solar PV system
Drafting design and engineering specifications for a biogas plant
Providing legal services to the Sustainable Energy Unit
RFQ for Technical Expert to develop wind map for the Kingdom of Bahrain
SEU Branding & Communication Strategy, and Website Developmen
Technical Expert to develop grid connection guidelines and standards for the Kingdom of Bahrain

description.narrative: This project aims to enhance national capacity to manage energy efficiently and address current gaps in the energy sector.
capital of a political entity
policy, planning and administration
Energy Efficiency/ Renewable Energy Strategy/ Policy/ Action Plan in place with nationally adopted targets

comment.narrative: Currently the country does not have a coherent approach to address issues of sustainable energy; mainly energy efficiency and renewable energy. There is no National Energy Policy Paper; Energy Efficiency Strategy nor Renewable Energy Strategy. There are no national targets for energy efficiency or renewable energy.
- Development of two draft national policies on the NEEAP and NREAP - Updating one paper on the Gap Analysis - Proposing structure for SEU
- National Energy Action Plan (NEEAP) and National Renewable Energy Action Plan (NREAP) were developed. - Gap Analysis was updated. - A proposed organigram for SEU was developed.

- Assist Bahrain define and adopt National target for RE (Renewable Energy) - Assist Bahrain define and adopt National target for EE (Energy Efficiency) - Develop and present policy options to promote RE - Start the process of establishing the SEU as part of the Government Structure - Support the implementation of NEEAP and NREAP

- Cabinet adopted EE target of 6% by 2025 - Cabinet adopted RE target of 5% by 2025 and 10% by 2035 - The project prepared and presented a full policy package for Net Metering Policy which was approved by HRH Crown Prince on 16 November 2017 for full implementation effective January 2018. - Extensive consultations were held with relevant Government entities for the establishment of the SEU and required documents have been drafted - SEU is a member in the Implementation and Follow-up Committee which was established as recommended by SEU through Cabinet resolution. SEU provided technical support on several NEEAP and NREAP initiatives. - SEU commissioned a consultant to develop a Wind Atlas for Bahrain.

title.narrative: Strengthening Capacity of Special Investigation Unit

description.narrative: This project aims to enhance capacity of the Special Investigation Unit (SIU) at the Public Prosecutor's Office to perform its role and assume its responsibilities in an efficient manner and according to international standards.

title.narrative: Capacity Building of the Special Investigation Unit of the Public Prosecution

description.narrative: Strengthening structure and capacity of the Public Prosecution to comply with the BICI recommendations & improving Case Management systems and Communication Plans at the SIU.
capital of a political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

1- Improved roles and responsibilities at SIU. 2- Case management System in place that provides real time information on case status and statistics 3- Internal and external communication and coordination enhanced

comment.narrative: • SIU established with basic structure and capacities • No database for SIU case management • No technical expertise available • No communication strategy

1. Building the communication capacity of the SIU. 2. Support SIU in publishing the first annual report. 3. Improve data analysis process. 4. Continue capacity building for the SIU Prosecutors and Police Officers.

The SIU is sustainably following the Istanbul Protocol. There has been a focus on building the communication capacity of the SIU. An assistance was provided to carry out SIU’s first annual report highlighting their work in carrying out the BICI recommendations. Through the expert’s support, recommendations were provided and worked on to enhance the data analysis process utilize it in the documentation process during report preparations and publications process. A partnership with the British Embassy has been established to support the unit, where a joint capacity building program has been initiated to train the SIU Prosecutors and Police Officers on the processes of Witness Protection, as the unit is building its own witness relations department.
1. Capacity building for the SIU Prosecutors and Police Officers. 2. Build on communication capacity building.
The unit hired a consultant that is now based there with extensive experience in human rights who is working on guiding the unit members and building their capacities.

The project will revise the National Housing policy and Strategy of the Kingdom of Bahrain to respond to the housing sector challenges. The project will produce a “participatory evidence-based revised housing policy and strategies.
Evidence-based Bahrain Housing Policy and Strategy with short, medium and long term plans for action formulated based on consultations will relevant stakeholders.
capital of a political entity
Energy - power generation

Availability of updated Evidence-based National Housing Policy and Strategy Document with detailed implementation plan.
Production of Housing Profile.

comment.narrative: National housing policy documents (2002-2022)

1) Form a team with UN Habitat and Ministry of Housing to carry out the project 2) Have the inception mission and create a work plan 3) Conduct data collection exercise 4) Have a first draft on housing profile
1) Achieved 2) Achieved 3) Ongoing 4) The work is in progress to have the first draft Moreover, housing policy workshops are planned and the first one has been conducted.

description.narrative: Conversion of the existing MENAPAR Network into an effective and efficient MENAPAR institution, legally, financially and functional.
MENAPAR institutionalization aims at converting the network into an effective independent and efficient institution.
independent political entity
Health - policy, planning and administration
- A secretariat of MENAPAR network is in existence - At least 2 MENAPAR registration options are suggested to the network's board.

comment.narrative: MENAPAR is not an institutionalized registered network
- Commencement of looking into the best options of registrations options - Hiring a project officer, administering the MENAPAR project

- An option of registration the MENAPAR network has been shortlisted, and the registration process has been initiated. - A project officer, administering the MENAPAR project has been hired and will start duties on 10 December 2017.
